hotciv.view
Class CivDrawing

java.lang.Object
  minidraw.standard.AbstractFigure
      minidraw.standard.CompositeFigure
          minidraw.standard.StandardDrawing
              hotciv.view.CivDrawing
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameObserver, java.util.EventListener, minidraw.framework.Drawing, minidraw.framework.DrawingChangeListenerHandler, minidraw.framework.Figure, minidraw.framework.FigureChangeListener, minidraw.framework.SelectionHandler
public class CivDrawing
extends minidraw.standard.StandardDrawing
implements minidraw.framework.Drawing, GameObserver

CivDrawing is a specialized Drawing (model component) from MiniDraw that dynamically builds the list of Figures for MiniDraw to render the Unit and other information objects that are visible in the Game instance. This is a TEMPLATE for the dSoftArk Exercise! This means that it is INCOMPLETE and that there are several options for CLEANING UP THE CODE when you add features to it! This source code is from the book "Flexible, Reliable Software: Using Patterns and Agile Development" published 2010 by CRC Press. Author: Henrik B Christensen Computer Science Department Aarhus University This source code is provided WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY either expressed or implied. You may study, use, modify, and distribute it for non-commercial purposes. For any commercial use, see http://www.baerbak.com/

Method Detail

add

public minidraw.framework.Figure add(minidraw.framework.Figure arg0)
The UnitDrawing should not allow client side units to add and manipulate figures; only figures that renders game objects are relevant, and these should be handled by observer events from the game instance. Thus this method is 'killed'.

Specified by:
add in interface minidraw.framework.Drawing
Overrides:
add in class minidraw.standard.CompositeFigure

worldChangedAt

public void worldChangedAt(Position pos)
Description copied from interface: GameObserver
invoked every time some change occurs on a position in the world - a unit disappears or appears, a city appears, a city changes player color, or any other event that requires the GUI to redraw the graphics on a particular position.

Specified by:
worldChangedAt in interface GameObserver
Parameters:
pos - the position in the world that has changed state

turnEnds

public void turnEnds(Player nextPlayer,
                     int age)
Description copied from interface: GameObserver
invoked just after the game's end of turn is called to signal the new "player in turn" and world age state.

Specified by:
turnEnds in interface GameObserver
Parameters:
nextPlayer - the next player that may move units etc.
age - the present age of the world

tileFocusChangedAt

Description copied from interface: GameObserver
invoked whenever the user changes focus to another tile (for inspecting the tile's unit and city properties.)

tileFocusChangedAt in interface GameObserver
Parameters:
